gameobjects

Class PlayerShip

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameobjects.AbstractGameObject
      • gameobjects.AbstractShip
        • gameobjects.PlayerShip
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameObject, Shooter

    public class PlayerShip
extends AbstractShip
implements Shooter
    This class defines a ship that's controlled by a player and can shoot.

      • movementKeyPressed

        public void movementKeyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent keyEvent)
        This method handles key controls for movement. It increases the velocity by a set acceleration when the appropriate key events are passed. It does not allow the velocity to be above a certain max velocity.
        Parameters:
        keyEvent - the key event

      • movementKeyReleased

        public void movementKeyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent keyEvent)
        This method handles key controls for stoppig movement. If the appropriate key event is passed it sets velocity to 0.
        Parameters:
        keyEvent - the key event

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        This method is responisble for firing bullets. When it's called, it check if it's time for the shooter to shoot. If so, it asks the engine to fire a bullet in it's name and restarts the cooldown.
        Specified by:
        shoot in interface Shooter

      • timeToShoot

        public boolean timeToShoot()
        Description copied from interface: Shooter
        This method checks if it's time for the shooter to shoot or if it's still cooling down.
        Specified by:
        timeToShoot in interface Shooter
        Returns:
        returns true if it's time to shoot. False otherwise
